deck.name: B2 â€“ Upper-Intermediate Vocabulary
deck.description: Upper-intermediate: engage in detailed discussions, understand news, and express nuanced ideas.

cards.definition: existing as an idea rather than a physical thing
cards.context: Freedom is an abstract concept.

cards.definition: a very large quantity of something
cards.context: The region has an abundance of natural resources.
Dust accumulates quickly on the shelves.
She acknowledged her mistake.
He acquired a taste for classical music.
Animals adapt to their environment over time.
The apartment has adequate space for a family.
She advocates for equal rights.

cards.definition: a list of items to be discussed at a meeting
cards.context: What is on the agenda for today?

cards.definition: to distribute for a specific purpose
cards.context: The government allocated funds for education.
We need to alter the design slightly.

cards.definition: a strong desire to achieve something
cards.context: Her ambition is to become a surgeon.
We need to analyze the data carefully.
We anticipate a busy holiday season.

cards.definition: to attract interest; a serious request
cards.context: The idea appeals to young people.
The teacher assessed the students\

cards.definition: to give someone a task or role
cards.context: The manager assigned me a new project.

cards.definition: to connect in your mind; a colleague
cards.context: People associate summer with holidays.

cards.definition: to take for granted without proof
cards.context: Do not assume everyone agrees with you.
I assure you the problem will be fixed.

cards.definition: something valuable owned by a person or company
cards.context: The company sold some of its assets.
The company went bankrupt last year.

cards.definition: a type of product made by a particular company
cards.context: This brand is known for quality.

cards.definition: money or resources available for investment
cards.context: They need more capital to expand.

cards.definition: the activity of buying and selling
cards.context: E-commerce has transformed shopping.

cards.definition: a raw material or basic good
cards.context: Oil is a valuable commodity.

cards.definition: a person who buys goods or services
cards.context: Consumers are demanding higher quality products.
She works in the corporate headquarters.

cards.definition: the money used in a particular country
cards.context: The local currency is the euro.
There has been a decline in sales.

cards.definition: the amount by which something falls short
cards.context: The country has a large trade deficit.

cards.definition: relating to the home or one\
cards.context: Domestic flights are cheaper than international ones.
She started a small enterprise selling crafts.

cards.definition: to sell goods to another country
cards.context: Brazil exports a lot of coffee.
He works in finance.

cards.definition: a sum of money saved for a purpose
cards.context: They set up a fund for research.

cards.definition: to bring goods in from another country
cards.context: Japan imports most of its oil.
Inflation has risen to three percent.

cards.definition: to put money into something to make a profit
cards.context: She invested in property.

cards.definition: to start or introduce something new
cards.context: The company launched a new product.

cards.definition: the difference between cost and selling price
cards.context: Profit margins are very thin this year.

cards.definition: to discuss terms to reach an agreement
cards.context: We negotiated a better price.

cards.definition: the result of a process or event
cards.context: The outcome of the negotiations was positive.
The company made a profit this quarter.
Many businesses closed during the recession.
Annual revenue exceeded expectations.

cards.definition: shares in a company; supply of goods
cards.context: The stock market dropped sharply.
We need a new marketing strategy.
Our target is to double sales this year.

cards.definition: to produce or generate a return
cards.context: The investment yielded a good return.

cards.definition: an organized effort to achieve something
cards.context: The charity ran an awareness campaign.

cards.definition: a legal member of a country
cards.context: Every citizen has the right to vote.

cards.definition: relating to citizens or the state
cards.context: Civil rights are protected by law.
The conflict lasted for several years.

cards.definition: dishonest behavior by those in power
cards.context: Corruption is a major obstacle to development.

cards.definition: a time of serious difficulty or danger
cards.context: The country faced an economic crisis.

cards.definition: a formal discussion of opposing views
cards.context: There was a heated debate about immigration.

cards.definition: a system of government by the people
cards.context: Democracy depends on free elections.

cards.definition: unfair treatment based on personal characteristics
cards.context: Discrimination based on gender is illegal.
London is a diverse city.
The organization fights for gender equality.

cards.definition: relating to a group sharing culture or origin
cards.context: The city has a rich ethnic diversity.

cards.definition: a set of beliefs or ideas
cards.context: Political ideology shapes policy decisions.

cards.definition: the act of coming to live in a foreign country
cards.context: Immigration has increased in recent years.
Justice must be served.

cards.definition: open to new ideas; favoring individual freedom
cards.context: She holds liberal views on education.

cards.definition: a smaller group within a larger one
cards.context: The rights of minorities must be protected.
Many people opposed the new law.

cards.definition: a set of rules or guidelines
cards.context: The company has a strict privacy policy.
The government proposed education reform.

cards.definition: to control by rules or laws
cards.context: The industry needs to be better regulated.

cards.definition: a dramatic change or overthrow of a system
cards.context: The digital revolution changed communication.

cards.definition: the health and happiness of people
cards.context: The government is responsible for public welfare.
The country abolished the death penalty.

cards.definition: to take in or soak up
cards.context: Plants absorb water through their roots.
She accompanied her friend to the hospital.

cards.definition: to provide space or adjust for
cards.context: The hotel can accommodate 200 guests.

cards.definition: to make clear or easier to understand
cards.context: Could you clarify what you mean?
The two teams collaborated on the project.
The old building collapsed during the storm.
The company compensated the customer for the delay.
All employees must comply with the safety regulations.
The committee comprises ten members.
I cannot concentrate with all this noise.

cards.definition: to bring to an end; to reach a judgment
cards.context: The study concluded that exercise reduces stress.
They conducted an investigation into the incident.

cards.definition: to face up to a difficult situation
cards.context: She confronted him about the issue.
The patient consented to the treatment.
Women constitute half the workforce.

cards.definition: to seek advice or information from
cards.context: You should consult a lawyer.

cards.definition: to change from one form to another
cards.context: They converted the barn into a house.
The two countries agreed to cooperate on security.
She learned to cope with stress.

cards.definition: to match or be equivalent; to exchange letters
cards.context: The results correspond with our predictions.
What are the criteria for selection?

cards.definition: to devote time and effort to
cards.context: She dedicated her life to helping others.
How do you define success?
The experiment demonstrated the theory.
The word derives from Latin.
The sensor detected a gas leak.
We need to determine the cause of the problem.
Her enthusiasm did not diminish over time.
He dismissed the idea immediately.
The museum displays ancient artifacts.
It is hard to distinguish the twins.

cards.definition: to give out to several people
cards.context: They distributed food to the refugees.
The team dominated the match from start to finish.
I drafted a proposal for the client.
Could you elaborate on your plan?
We need to eliminate unnecessary costs.
New evidence has emerged.
We encountered several problems during the trip.
The software update enhanced performance.

cards.definition: to judge the value or quality of
cards.context: The committee will evaluate all applications.
Technology continues to evolve rapidly.
Sales exceeded our expectations.

cards.definition: to use selfishly or to full advantage
cards.context: The company exploits natural resources.
Technology facilitates communication.
Temperatures fluctuate throughout the day.
They forecast heavy rain for the weekend.
She formulated a plan to reduce costs.
The university was founded in 1850.
She fulfilled her childhood dream.

cards.definition: to promise that something will happen
cards.context: The company guarantees delivery within 48 hours.
The report highlights key challenges.
Let me illustrate my point with an example.
The company implemented a new policy.
Are you implying that I was wrong?
The government imposed strict restrictions.
I am inclined to agree with you.

cards.definition: to include as part of something
cards.context: We incorporated feedback into the design.
The president initiated peace talks.
The inspector inspected the building for safety.
The school integrates technology into lessons.
How do you interpret these results?

cards.definition: to become involved to change a situation
cards.context: The teacher intervened to stop the argument.

cards.definition: to give a valid reason for
cards.context: How can you justify the expense?

cards.definition: to keep in good condition; to continue
cards.context: She maintains a healthy lifestyle.
He tried to manipulate the situation.
We modified the recipe slightly.
Doctors monitor the patient\

cards.definition: to fail to care for properly
cards.context: He neglected his responsibilities.
She obtained a visa for the trip.

cards.definition: to fill or hold a space
cards.context: The meeting occupied the entire afternoon.

cards.definition: to succeed in dealing with a difficulty
cards.context: She overcame her fear of flying.

cards.definition: to become aware of through senses or mind
cards.context: People perceive the situation differently.
She persisted in her efforts to learn.
He possesses excellent leadership skills.

cards.definition: to delay to a later time
cards.context: They postponed the meeting until next week.

cards.definition: to say what will happen in the future
cards.context: It is difficult to predict the weather.

cards.definition: to keep safe from harm or decay
cards.context: We should preserve our cultural heritage.
Please proceed to the next page.
Smoking is prohibited in public buildings.

cards.definition: to follow or try to achieve
cards.context: She pursued a career in journalism.

cards.definition: to keep or continue to have
cards.context: The company retained most of its staff.
I managed to retrieve the lost document.
The plan incorporates elements from both proposals.

cards.definition: to experience or be subjected to
cards.context: She underwent surgery last month.

cards.definition: to commit to and begin a task
cards.context: He undertook the project with enthusiasm.
Doctors urge people to get vaccinated.

cards.definition: to break a rule or law
cards.context: He violated the terms of his contract.
She withdrew money from the bank.
The idea is absolutely absurd.

cards.definition: said to be true but not yet proved
cards.context: The alleged thief was arrested yesterday.

cards.definition: having a strong desire to succeed
cards.context: She is an ambitious young lawyer.

cards.definition: by a person whose name is not known
cards.context: The donation was made by an anonymous benefactor.
The restaurant serves authentic Italian food.

cards.definition: lasting for a long time; recurring
cards.context: She suffers from chronic back pain.

cards.definition: including all or nearly all aspects
cards.context: The report provides a comprehensive overview.
Education is compulsory until age 16.
We need concrete evidence.
It was a controversial decision.
Timing is crucial in this plan.
It was a deliberate attempt to mislead.
The forest is very dense.
The two languages have distinct sounds.
English is the dominant language in business.

cards.definition: sudden and striking; related to drama
cards.context: There has been a dramatic change in the situation.

cards.definition: meeting the conditions to do something
cards.context: You must be 18 to be eligible to vote.
One mile is equivalent to 1.6 kilometers.
Excessive noise can damage your hearing.
The instructions are explicit about safety.
There is fierce competition in this market.
Trust is fundamental to any relationship.
The climate was hostile to farming.
Change is inevitable in business.
The cheap version is inferior in quality.
The company is known for its innovative products.
The heat was intense in the desert.
She raised a legitimate concern.
That is a logical conclusion.
The project requires a massive investment.

cards.definition: shared by two or more people
cards.context: The decision was based on mutual agreement.
Switzerland remained neutral during the war.

cards.definition: not influenced by personal feelings; a goal
cards.context: Try to be objective in your analysis.
The investigation is ongoing.
I prefer organic vegetables.
The response was overwhelming.

cards.definition: lasting forever or for a very long time
cards.context: She got a permanent position at the firm.
She was persistent in her search for the truth.
Please give me the precise measurements.

cards.definition: coming before a main event or action
cards.context: The preliminary results look promising.
She is a prominent figure in politics.
The plan involves radical changes.

cards.definition: based on reason rather than emotion
cards.context: We need a rational approach to this problem.
He was reluctant to accept the offer.
She made remarkable progress.
The school has rigid rules.
She grew up in a rural area.

cards.definition: easily affected by things; aware of feelings
cards.context: He is very sensitive about his weight.
The storm caused severe damage.
The water near the shore is shallow.
I am skeptical about his claims.
She was the sole survivor.
The system uses sophisticated technology.
The trip was completely spontaneous.
The economy has been stable this year.
There is a subtle difference between the two.
We do not have sufficient information yet.
This material is superior to the other one.
We need sustainable solutions to climate change.
It is only a temporary arrangement.
She did a thorough investigation.
She has made tremendous progress.
The ultimate goal is world peace.
We need to address the underlying cause.
Every fingerprint is unique.
Urban areas have more traffic problems.
His explanation was very vague.
The Sahara is a vast desert.
Children are especially vulnerable to pollution.

cards.definition: found or distributed over a large area
cards.context: There is widespread concern about the virus.

cards.definition: worth the time or effort spent
cards.context: It was a worthwhile investment.

cards.definition: a claim that someone has done wrong
cards.context: He denied the allegations.
She used an analogy to explain the concept.

cards.definition: something accepted as true without proof
cards.context: Your assumption is incorrect.

cards.definition: a person or group with power
cards.context: The authorities are investigating the matter.

cards.definition: an unfair preference for or against something
cards.context: The report is free from bias.
The river forms the boundary between the two countries.
The tax is a burden on small businesses.

cards.definition: the maximum amount something can hold
cards.context: The stadium has a capacity of 50,000.
The collapse of the bridge shocked everyone.

cards.definition: a pledge or dedication to something
cards.context: She showed great commitment to the project.

cards.definition: a person you spend time with
cards.context: The dog became her loyal companion.

cards.definition: a part of a larger whole
cards.context: Each component must be tested separately.
You need parental consent for this trip.
The decision caused a lot of controversy.

cards.definition: a difficult choice between two options
cards.context: She faced a moral dilemma.
The problem has many dimensions.

cards.definition: controlled behavior; a field of study
cards.context: Success requires discipline and hard work.

cards.definition: a disturbance that prevents normal operation
cards.context: The strike caused major disruption to services.
There is a clear distinction between the two ideas.
The emphasis is on practical skills.

cards.definition: a long period of time in history
cards.context: We are living in the digital era.

cards.definition: the most important quality of something
cards.context: Trust is the essence of friendship.
According to estimates, costs will double.

cards.definition: a basic structure underlying a system
cards.context: The project operates within a legal framework.

cards.definition: a proposed explanation to be tested
cards.context: The scientist tested her hypothesis.
The government launched a new health initiative.
The book provides valuable insights into human behavior.
In this instance, the decision was correct.
The notion that money brings happiness is debatable.
Language was the main obstacle to communication.

cards.definition: a particular way of viewing things
cards.context: Try to see it from a different perspective.
Global warming is a well-documented phenomenon.

cards.definition: a part considered in relation to the whole
cards.context: A large proportion of students passed the exam.
Job prospects in technology are excellent.

cards.definition: an area of activity or interest
cards.context: This is beyond the realm of possibility.

cards.definition: the range or extent of something
cards.context: The scope of the project is very broad.

cards.definition: a distinct part of the economy or society
cards.context: The technology sector is growing rapidly.

cards.definition: a set of things following in order
cards.context: Follow the sequence of instructions carefully.

cards.definition: a change in position or direction
cards.context: There has been a shift in public opinion.
The discovery had great scientific significance.
The book covers a spectrum of topics.
The tax cut was a stimulus for the economy.

cards.definition: a feeling of nervousness or strain
cards.context: There is tension between the two departments.

cards.definition: a point at which something begins
cards.context: She has a low pain threshold.

cards.definition: a change from one state to another
cards.context: The transition to remote work was smooth.
The app has great practical utility.
There are regional variations in accent.

cards.definition: in a way that is appropriate
cards.context: Plan your work and act accordingly.
Prices have risen considerably.
Some love the rain; conversely, others hate it.
The plan is essentially the same.

cards.definition: in addition to what has been said
cards.context: The hotel is expensive. Furthermore, it is far from the center.
She studied hard, hence her excellent results.
I enjoyed the film. My friend felt likewise.
The plan is risky. Moreover, it is expensive.
It was raining; nevertheless, we went for a walk.
The task was difficult; nonetheless, she completed it.

cards.definition: in general; taking everything into account
cards.context: Overall, the project was a success.
The course is primarily for beginners.

cards.definition: used to say something is probably true
cards.context: Presumably, you have read the report.
I have a question regarding the schedule.
Tom and Sara scored 85 and 90 respectively.

cards.definition: in an important way; by a large amount
cards.context: Results improved significantly.
The task was somewhat more difficult than expected.

cards.definition: by that means; as a result of that
cards.context: He resigned, thereby ending the controversy.

cards.definition: in contrast to the fact that
cards.context: She likes classical music, whereas he prefers jazz.
They created a system whereby complaints are handled quickly.
